definition: ambition of wild wolves (idiom); rapacious designs
wolf/CL:匹[pi3],隻|只[zhi1],條|条[tiao2]
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
field/plain/open space/limit/boundary/rude/feral
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: His wild ambition was thoroughly exposed.
sentences.chinese: 他的狼子野心暴露無遺。

sentences.english: All these indicate the wild ambition of Japanese Fascist militarism arid the confusion of right and wrong.
sentences.chinese: 這些足見日本法西斯軍國主義的狼子野心和顛倒是非。

definition: to harbor evil intentions (idiom); concealing malice
harboring unfathomable motives (idiom)
lit. to nurture a tiger invites calamity/fig. to indulge one's enemy is asking for trouble (idiom)
see 居心叵測|居心叵测[ju1 xin1 po3 ce4]
breaking faith and abandoning right (idiom); to betray/treachery/perfidy
to conspire
rebels and traitors (idiom)/general term for scoundrel
to rebel against the emperor (idiom)
a traitor/a treacherous bandit
to bite the hand that feeds one (idiom)
to go against the tide (idiom); to do things all wrong/to try to turn back history/a perverse way of doing things
to act as accomplice to the tiger/to help a villain do evil (idiom)
abundantly clear
to have sinister motives
renegade/traitor and bandit
to show the wolf into the house (idiom)/to introduce a potential source of trouble
